summary: The Jordan McNair Student Athlete Heat Fatality Prevention Act addresses heat-related illnesses in student athletes. It mandates institutions of higher education and secondary schools participating in athletic programs to develop and implement venue-specific emergency action plans within one year of enactment. These plans must include symptom identification, coordination of care, and be distributed to relevant personnel. Schools must report compliance annually. The bill also directs the Secretary of Education to inform institutions and schools about available federal funds for heat illness prevention.
